intro: Rhus albida, commonly known as the white stinkbush, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other plants like poison ivy and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often divided into multiple leaflets, and its small, greenish-white flowers. Rhus albida produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It is often found in coastal and sandy environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
